root.name: The Driver
root.description: An early cinematic racing-action arcade video game developed and released by Kasco (Kansai Seiki Seisakusho Co.) in the 1970s. It consisted of pre-filmed FMV situations recorded on 16 mm film that required the player to match their steering wheel, gas pedal and brakes with the movements shown on screen, much like the quick time events seen in laserdisc video games of the 1980s.Originally released by Kasco in Japan, the game was distributed in the United States by U.S. Billiards.
